title: How Do You Get Celebi in Pokémon Crystal, Gold & Silver?

steps.title: Open the Cheats menu within your emulator.
steps.content: Open the Cheats menu within your emulator. As you’re playing Pokémon Crystal , Gold , or Silver , head to the Cheats menu within the emulator’s interface. While the exact location of this menu depends on the platform you’re using and the device you’re playing on. A mobile device, for instance, might have a menu button (like ☰) that has a Cheats button hidden away, while a computer-based emulator might have a menu bar along the top of the game.

steps.title: Enter chest code 91FB04D2 (Crystal) or 01FBEDD0 (Gold/Silver) as a new cheat.
steps.content: Enter chest code 91FB04D2 (Crystal) or 01FBEDD0 (Gold/Silver) as a new cheat. The “add cheat” option may differ depending on the emulator you’re using; on some platforms, you may need to hit an Add GameShark… to enter the cheat code. [1] X Research source This cheat makes it that the next wild Pokémon you encounter will be a Celebi. If the code starting in 9 doesn’t work for Pokémon Crystal, try 01FB04D2. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a patch of wild grass and catch a Celebi.
steps.content: Enter a patch of wild grass and catch a Celebi. The next Pokémon you run into should be a Celebi. Use whatever Poké Balls you have to catch it and add it to your party.

steps.title: Disable the cheat when you’re done.
steps.content: Disable the cheat when you’re done. Go back to your Cheat settings and either disable or remove the cheat (so normal Pokémon start spawning again).

steps.title: Achieve Pokémon Champion status in-game.
steps.content: Achieve Pokémon Champion status in-game. Make sure that you’ve beaten all the gyms, conquered the Elite 4, and defeated the existing Pokémon Champion before taking on the mantle for yourself. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Meet with the NPC at the Pokémon Center in Goldenrod City.
steps.content: Meet with the NPC at the Pokémon Center in Goldenrod City. Take a few steps into the Goldenrod City Pokémon Center to be approached by an NPC, who hands you the GS Ball item. This was originally an Event-exclusive item that allowed Japanese players to get Celebi for a limited amount of time on the Game Boy Color in Pokémon Crystal .

steps.title: Visit Kurt in Azalea Town and give him the GS Ball.
steps.content: Visit Kurt in Azalea Town and give him the GS Ball. After teleporting/flying to Azalea Town, walk up and to the left of your teleport point to reach Kurt’s house. Once inside, give Kurt the GS Ball that the NPC gave you earlier. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Collect your name, ID number, and in-game currency info from the save menu.
steps.content: Collect your name, ID number, and in-game currency info from the save menu. Toggle your Save menu within the game and jot down your exact name, as well as your ID number and the number of Poké Dollars you have.

steps.title: Save and exit the game.
steps.content: Save and exit the game. You need to wait for a long chunk of in-game time before you can talk to Kurt and proceed to catching the Celebi, so it’s easier to skip ahead.

steps.title: Enter your name, ID, and money info on this site to receive a password.
steps.content: Enter your name, ID, and money info on this site to receive a password. Make sure that you have Pokémon Crystal selected on the site, along with the correct in-game language.

steps.title: Open up the game again and toggle the reset screen.
steps.content: Open up the game again and toggle the reset screen. Press Down , B , and Select , and let go of Down and B after a moment. Next, press the Up , Left , and Select buttons as you start up the game; then, release the Select button. The next screen that pops up should allow you to change your in-game time. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the 5-digit reset code and set the clock to the following day.
steps.content: Enter the 5-digit reset code and set the clock to the following day. Once you type in the correct password, hit Continue and adjust the in-game time so it’s at least 1 day later.

steps.title: Head back into your game and talk to Kurt.
steps.content: Head back into your game and talk to Kurt. Now that an in-game day has passed, Kurt will be finished inspecting the GS Ball. Follow him outside, and he’ll eventually hand the GS Ball back to you.

steps.title: Visit the shrine in Ilex Forest.
steps.content: Visit the shrine in Ilex Forest. Head west (left) through the tunnel out of Azalea Town, which leads you to the Ilex Forest. Make your way back through the woods until you see a shrine—it’ll be blocked by a tree. Cut this tree down, and make sure you’re standing in front of the shrine.

steps.title: Save your game.
steps.content: Save your game. In the event that you can’t catch the Celebi on your first try, this save point makes it easy to restart your efforts.

steps.title: Put the GS Ball in the shrine.
steps.content: Put the GS Ball in the shrine. Interact with the shrine, which allows you to place the GS Ball inside. A wild Celebi appears after you do this! [6] X Research source

steps.title: Battle and catch the Celebi.
steps.content: Battle and catch the Celebi. Just like you would in any other battle, strategically attack the Celebi (without making it faint) and tossing Poké Balls at it until it’s successfully caught. If something goes wrong, don’t worry about it—just reboot your game and restart at the past save point.

steps.title: Fill your PC with items in a specific amount and order.
steps.content: Fill your PC with items in a specific amount and order. Head to your PC and acquire the following items (in this exact amount and order): [7] X Research source Any item: Any number Any item: Any number TM 27: 2 Fresh Water: 42 Lovely Mail: 1 HM 07: 1 Poké Ball: 65 Great Ball: 4 Everstone: 1 Any item: Any number Surf Mail: 51 Full Heal: 18 Flower Mail: 46 HM 03: 1 X Speed: 1 TM 06: 1 Any item: Any number TM 41: 1 Tip: For the “Any item” slots, make sure you’re choosing unique items for each one. If you have duplicates, the glitch won’t launch properly.

steps.title: Assemble your party with 4 specific Pokémon.
steps.content: Assemble your party with 4 specific Pokémon. You’ll need certain types of Pokémon in your party for the glitch to work properly: [8] X Research source Slot 1: Weak Pokémon (any type) Slot 2: Pokémon that knows Fly (not required, but helpful) Slot 3: Weak Pokémon (any type) Slot 4: Quagsire holding HP Up with Sleep Talk as its first ability

steps.title: Head to Professor Elm’s lab and save your game file.
steps.content: Head to Professor Elm’s lab and save your game file. Fly to New Bark Town, where Professor Elm is situated. After stepping into his lab, pull up your save menu and save your game file.

steps.title: Restart the game.
steps.content: Restart the game. Now that you’ve saved, leave the game, restart, and re-enter.

steps.title: Walk to the nearby tree outside the lab and listen to Bellsprout’s Pokédex sound.
steps.content: Walk to the nearby tree outside the lab and listen to Bellsprout’s Pokédex sound. Pine trees flank Professor Elm’s lab—what you want to do is find the pine tree just to the right of the building. While standing next to it, pull up your Pokédex, scroll to Bellsprout’s entry, and listen Bellsprout’s cry. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Use the Coin Case to launch the glitch.
steps.content: Use the Coin Case to launch the glitch. Go to your Inventory and toggle over to the Key Items pocket, where you’ll find the Coin Case. Hit Use ; if the glitch works correctly, a pop-up will appear on the screen that says Coins: 0 . [10] X Research source Troubleshooting: If the glitch doesn’t work, you may have to switch out the low-level Pokémon you have for other weak Pokémon. Repeat the process of heading to the tree, accessing your Pokédex, listening to the Bellsprout sound, and using the Coin Case. It might take multiple tries (and many weak Pokémon) before the glitch works, so don’t give up!

steps.title: Give your 1st slot Pokémon to the Nursery in Goldenrod City.
steps.content: Give your 1st slot Pokémon to the Nursery in Goldenrod City. You don’t need to drop any other Pokémon off—just leave the slot 1 Pokémon there, and then leave the building. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Walk around for a little while and pick your Pokémon back up from the Nursery.
steps.content: Walk around for a little while and pick your Pokémon back up from the Nursery. By waiting a little bit, your Pokémon will have time to level up while at the Nursery; in fact, the Nursery staff member will say as much in your conversation. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Check your Pokédex to confirm that Celebi is there.
steps.content: Check your Pokédex to confirm that Celebi is there. After leveling up at the Nursery, your original slot 1 Pokémon has magically turned into a Celebi. Once you’re positive that the Legendary is in your party, save your game. [13] X Research source

steps.title: No, not in the original North American titles.
steps.content: No, not in the original North American titles. Unfortunately, Celebi isn’t organically available in the original Pokémon Gold or Silver . While it was possible to catch Celebi through a Japanese-exclusive event in 2001, the Legendary was never available in the NA release of the game. If you have a non-Japanese copy of the original Pokémon Gold , Silver , or Crystal , you’re unfortunately unable to get a legitimate Celebi on your game file. On the 3DS Virtual Console, Celebi is only available on Pokémon Crystal , not Gold or Silver .
